title.narrative: Regasification Facility and Pipeline Project, through Lixia Capsia Gestionis LLC

description.narrative: This grant will partially fund a feasibility study (FS) for the Ministry of Energy, Mines and Sustainable Development to evaluate the development of a Moroccan liquified natural gas (LNG) terminal, regasification facility and pipeline link. This FS will support Morocco's bid to meet its rising domestic energy demand while supporting the development of U.S. LNG export markets.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Marrakech Smart Grid Feasibility Study, through Africa Climate Solutions

description.narrative: USTDA is funding a feasibility study to enable Rgie Autonome de Distribution d'Eau et d'Electricit de Marrakech (RADEEMA), the state-owned power distribution company of the Marrakech-Safi region, to transform its power distribution infrastructure through a smart grid project. The project would help RADEEMA reduce technical and non-technical losses in the Marrakech Grid, reduce the frequency and downtime of network outages, reduce the cost of operations and maintenance for RADEEMA and electricity costs to its customers, and permit the incorporation of additional solar and other renewable energy into the grid.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Cloud Computing and e-Government Reverse Trade Mission, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: USTDA is funding a reverse trade mission (RTM) to familiarize delegates from Morocco's Ministry of Digital Transformation and Administrative Reform and related public and private sector entities with the latest U.S. cloud computing and digital government solutions. The RTM will also facilitate opportunities for U.S. firms to connect with delegates and learn of upcoming market opportunities.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Nareva Green Ammonia Plant Feasibility Study, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: USTDA is funding a feasibility study to support Nareva Holding, Morocco's leading independent power producer, in developing a green ammonia plant with an expected capacity of 240,000 tons per annum. The study would enable Nareva to select the optimal Project site, determine the Project's technical and economic feasibility, develop preliminary engineering designs and production, financial, and business models, and identify necessary permits and potential regulatory barriers.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Solar Photovoltaic, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: The $631,000 technical assistance for the Moroccan National Agency for the Development of Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency (ADEREE) provided a detailed assessment to evaluate and recommend the specific requirements of a 5 megawatt (MW) solar photovoltaic (PV) power facility, providing a baseline for evaluating and replicating solar PV plants of similar size and scope throughout Morocco. Implementation of this technology will help achieve the Government of Morocco's objectives to increase generating capacity from solar and other renewable sources while decreasing dependence on imported fossil fuels.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Solar Photovolatic, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: The Solar Photovoltaic (PV) Reverse Trade Mission enabled USTDA to host Moroccan officials in charge of implementing a variety of solar PV projects so that the key decision-makers could meet with U.S. companies able to provide leading solar PV technology solutions; engineering, procurement, and contract services; and other relevant expertise. Delegates also visited U.S. solar PV facilities that are similar to those planned for development in Morocco. The visit connected the Moroccan project sponsors with U.S. expertise and financing sources.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Distributed Power Generation/Fresh Water Production for Coastal Fishing Villages, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: The technical assistance (TA) with the Office National des Peches (ONP) [National Office of Fish] and Nexant provided a master plan for implementing renewable energy resources in remote fishing villages. The TA included an analysis of solar photovoltaic (PV) and small scale wind applications in six pilot fishing villages, resulting in a model for the application of sustainable sources of energy for electricity generation and clean water filtration in up to 60 fishing villages.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Port of Casablanca Safety and Security, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: The objective of this $571,458 feasibility study (FS) grant to Marsa Maroc is to improve security and safety at the Port of Casablanca. The FS evaluated and recommended the technical, institutional, and financial investments necessary for the Port of Casablanca to fully comply with international security mandates and goals.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Ports Vessel Traffic Management and Security and Surveillance Systems, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: USTDA provided a $280,238 grant to L'Agence Nationale des Ports to fund a feasibility study (FS) for a vessel traffic management system (VTMS)/security system for two ports in Morocco. The FS included a comprehensive evaluation of the Ports of Casablanca and Safia to identify the specific needs for a VTMS/security system. This included an assessment of the most appropriate technologies, and the development of technical specifications for six ports.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - MEAT PROCESSING FACILITY WASTEWATER TREATMENT, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $378,000 grant to the Moroccan Office of Potable Water to fund technical assistance (TA) related to the optimization of water usage schemes, and improved wastewater collection/pre-treatment systems in meat processing facilities throughout Morocco. The TA analyzes current waste generated by meat processing facilities in Morocco, identifies technical and financial specifications for on-site treatment and complete removal and disposal of wastewater, develops an action plan for pollution minimization, and develops a monitoring tool to ensure that the recommendations of the action plan are implemented and maintained. The Moroccan Office of Potable Water serves as the Grantee for this activity.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - WEATHER RADAR NETWORK, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $350,000 grant to the Moroccan National Meteorology Department to fund a feasibility study (FS) on the installation of an upgraded and expanded national weather radar network to increase coverage throughout the Kingdom of Morocco. The FS analyzes the benefits of improved radar coverage, including the ability to predict and respond to the occurrence of natural phenomena that could cause devastating loss of life and injury, severe damage to the environment, and destruction of the local economy. The FS recommends the most appropriate technical solution for upgrading and expanding the existing weather radar network in Morocco and also develops a procurement plan and bidding documents for the recommended technical solution.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - ONEP INDUSTRIAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $392,000 grant to the Moroccan Office of Potable Water to fund a feasibility study (FS) on the construction of an industrial wastewater treatment system in Berrechid to treat industry effluents and enable proper collection and pre-treatment of wastewater from the industrial park. The FS analyzes current waste generated by the industrial park, identifies the technical and financial specifications for on-site treatment and complete removal and disposal of the wastewater, develops a factory audit survey tool to assist in data collection during factory visits, prepares an operations and maintenance handbook for the proposed pre-treatment system, produces an instructional handbook on preparing funding application documents for financing from the Industrial Decontamination Fund (FODEP) - a clean technology investment financing mechanism, and organizes stakeholders workshops and a communication plan to convey study findings. This project will build trade capacity through increased access to international markets as a result of meeting European Union (EU) environmental regulations for wastewater treatment.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - COLD STORAGE NEEDS FOR PALM DATES, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: USTDA is funding a $531,810 grant to the Ministry of Agriculture to fund a Technical Assistance (TA) for cold storage infrastructure for palm dates. The TA includes a comprehensive study to identify the specific needs for cold storage infrastructure and facilities that would help reduce losses in the date palm production in Morocco, and a training component on the importance of cold storage that targets producers and producer associations.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - COLD CHAIN STORAGE FOR FISHERIES, through Government of Morocco

description.narrative: USTDA is funding a $462,970 grant for the Office National des Peches to fund a Technical Assistance (TA) for cold storage infrastructure for fisheries. The TA includes a comprehensive study to identify the specific needs for cold storage infrastructure and facilities that would help reduce losses of the fish catch in Morocco, and a training component on the importance of cold storage that targets producers and producer associations.

The TA assists the Government of Morocco in evaluating and substantially improving their water resource management and flood control systems in this important agricultural basin area.
